meanings.definition: To move or travel at a slow pace, like a snail.
meanings.sent1: The turtle was snailing along the path, taking its time.
meanings.sent2: She was snailing through the crowded market, enjoying the sights.
meanings.sent3: The sloth was snailing its way to the top of the tree, much to the amusement of the onlookers.
meanings.sent4: Time was snailing by, as if reluctant to move forward.
meanings.sent5: The old car was snailing down the road, barely making progress.

meanings.definition: The act of moving slowly or lazily.
meanings.sent1: The snailing of the river made for a peaceful afternoon by the banks.
meanings.sent2: His snailing through the chores annoyed his roommates.
meanings.sent3: The snailing of the sloth in the zoo was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent4: The snailing of the clouds across the sky signaled an impending storm.
meanings.sent5: The snailing of time on a lazy Sunday afternoon was pure bliss.

meanings.definition: A method of catching fish using a hook and line.
meanings.sent1: He learned the art of snailing from his grandfather, who was an expert fisherman.
meanings.sent2: The old man spent his days snailing by the river, reminiscing about the past.
meanings.sent3: The children were excited to try snailing for the first time during their camping trip.
meanings.sent4: The quiet lake was the perfect spot for a day of snailing.
meanings.sent5: The tradition of snailing had been passed down through generations in the village.
